name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List
description: File::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more files that match the request and this value should be passed to the next Google::Cloud::Storage::Bucket#files to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more files that match the request and this value should be passed to the next Google::Cloud::Storage::Bucket#files to continue.

methods.name: prefixes
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#prefixes
methods.description: The list of prefixes of objects matching-but-not-listed up to and including the requested delimiter.

methods.name: prefixes=
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#prefixes=
methods.description: The list of prefixes of objects matching-but-not-listed up to and including the requested delimiter.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of files.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
if files.next?
  next_files = files.next
end

require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
if files.next?
  next_files = files.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves remaining results by repeatedly invoking #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result, which is passed as the argument to the block.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method will make repeated API calls until all remaining results are retrieved. (Unlike #each, for example, which merely iterates over the results returned by a single API call.) Use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each file by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
files.all do |file|
  puts file.name
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files

all_names = files.all.map do |file|
  file.name
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
files = bucket.files
files.all(request_limit: 10) do |file|
  puts file.name
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all files. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each file.
